t7

Class StatementInterpreter

  • java.lang.Object
    • t7.StatementInterpreter

  • public class StatementInterpreter
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses the provided statements and calls the appropriate methods to execute them.
    Author:
    kinan

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public java.lang.String read(java.util.Scanner in)
                      throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Reads the next statement from the given scanner, the statement is not always one line, also, the statement best not start with empty lines, hence this method is needed.
        Parameters:
        in - the scanner to read input from.
        Returns:
        the next statement.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the given scanner does not contain more lines to read.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given scanner is closed.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • read

        public java.lang.String read(java.io.InputStream in)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next statement from the given input stream, the statement is not always one line, also, the statement best not start with empty lines, hence this method is needed.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to read input from.
        Returns:
        the next statement.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an exception happened while reading.

      • readLine

        private java.lang.String readLine(java.io.InputStream in)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads one line from the given input stream (or until EOF, if new line was not reached).
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream.
        Returns:
        one line (or until EOF).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an exception happened while reading.

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String statements)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes the given statements, statement-by-statement.
        Parameters:
        statements - the statements (body of the program).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - variety of exception types depending on the associated syntax error.

      • execute

        public void execute(java.io.File file)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes the given program, statement-by-statement.
        Parameters:
        file - the file that contains the program to be executed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - variety of exception types depending on the associated syntax error, Note that FileNotFoundException could be thrown in two cases, either the given file does not exist, or the given file contain a file-dependent statement (like load) that refers to a file that does not exist.

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String line)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Parses the given line.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to parse.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the statement is IO related and the file is inaccessible.

      • nonEmptyStartsWith

        public static boolean nonEmptyStartsWith(java.lang.String string,
                                         java.lang.String match)
        Checks if the first non empty characters match the given string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to look in.
        match - the prefix to match.
        Returns:
        true if the string starts with the match (disregarding leading empty space), false otherwise.

      • nonEmptyEndsWith

        public static boolean nonEmptyEndsWith(java.lang.String string,
                                       java.lang.String match)
        Checks if the last non empty characters match the given string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to look in.
        match - the suffix to match.
        Returns:
        true if the string ends with the match (disregarding leading empty space), false otherwise.
